page.title: 02Housing_ Old Hall Estate
page.content: The Old Hall Estate is a housing estate built on the site of Bentley Hall where Charles 2nd hid on his flight from the battle of Worcester in 1651. Lee Arnold writes " I am 11 years old, I am a boy and I live at 9, Berley Close, Old Hall Estate,Bentley Walsall. The estate has changed since it was built in 1979. There is now a shop, a community centre and a doctors surgery. The council are talking about building a pub but it seems unlikely to happen. The estate is good and I like the pool. My brother Craig goes fishing there alot. At the back of the houses there is an old railway line but it has been dismantled. Now they are filling it in with rubbish and dirt. Past the dismantled railway there is a school called Willenhall Comprehensive. I like the estate.
